pull.title: ci: add workflow to clean caches periodically
pull.body:
Deletes all caches on the 1st and 15th of each month.

Fixes #1691

repo.name: secp256k1
repo.description: Optimized C library for EC operations on curve secp256k1

repo.name: secp256k1
repo.description: Optimized C library for EC operations on curve secp256k1

events.body:
Concept ACK

I'm a bit hesitant due to the `actions: write` permission, but I tend to think it's okay here. This workflow doesn't even have an input that could be attacker controlled. And `actions` restricts it to GitHub Actions stuff.

events.message:
ci: add workflow to clean caches periodically

Fixes #1691

events.body:
It's shame that https://github.com/actions/cache does not provide an [option](https://github.com/actions/cache/issues/1338) to set a retention period explicitly.

I think we could avoid introducing a new workflow with the write permission by simply rotating the cache keys regularly. Feel free to grab a [commit](https://github.com/hebasto/secp256k1/commit/fdb026abc982daa858d6035e789dd15a88448a7a) from this [branch](https://github.com/hebasto/secp256k1/tree/260127-pr1807-alt).

> I think we could avoid introducing a new workflow with the write permission by simply rotating the cache keys regularly.

That seems cleaner indeed.


---

edit: This means for this PR:

Approach NACK

Unrelated to the changes in this PR, the current GCC snapshot has been failing self-tests since [ed2924c7628343ff8b699f320a05c85bdb9c2837](https://gcc.gnu.org/git/?p=gcc.git;a=commit;h=ed2924c7628343ff8b699f320a05c85bdb9c2837).

UPDATE: The issue should be fixed in [a6c3c48148dd60a09ffab57019f163180c159d65](https://gcc.gnu.org/git/?p=gcc.git;a=commit;h=a6c3c48148dd60a09ffab57019f163180c159d65).

> > I think we could avoid introducing a new workflow with the write permission by simply rotating the cache keys regularly.
> 
> That seems cleaner indeed.

Done in https://github.com/bitcoin-core/secp256k1/pull/1816.

comments.body: I think the description can be clearer here. Something like "Delete all GitHub Actions caches"

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,18 @@
+name: Caches
+on:
+  schedule:
+    - cron: '0 0 1,15 * *'
+  workflow_dispatch:
+
+permissions:
+  actions: write
+
+jobs:
+  clean:
+    name: Delete all caches
comments.body: I'd use the same name here because there's really only a single job in this workflow
